intro: Scabiosa arvensis var. serrata, commonly known as the serrated field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rounded, pink or purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Its leaves are serrated, giving it its specific variety name, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a valuable plant for supporting pollinators.
